com.example.noteation.adapters

Class CalendarAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<CalendarAdapter.CalendarViewHolder>
      • com.example.noteation.adapters.CalendarAdapter

  • public class CalendarAdapter
extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<CalendarAdapter.CalendarViewHolder>
    This class is in charge of linking the recyclerView in the "CalendarFragment" and "CalendarWeekViewFragment" views to create the month and week view calendars

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) static class  CalendarAdapter.CalendarViewHolder

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private java.lang.Boolean getDailyCalendarTasks(java.time.LocalDate date, android.content.Context context)
      Gets the all of the tasks or the current selected date
      int getItemCount() 
      int getItemViewType(int position) 
      void onBindViewHolder(CalendarAdapter.CalendarViewHolder holder, int position)
      Initializes one cell from the RecyclerView, it sets the text to the day of the month using the date from the days array (in the position param), if it is equals to today's date, then it highlights it it also sets an "OnClickListener" and checks if it's a month view or week view, if it's a month view then "calendarFragment.onItemClick" function is called, if it's a month view then "calendarWeekViewFragment.onItemClick" function is called
      CalendarAdapter.CalendarViewHolder onCreateViewHolder(android.view.ViewGroup parent, int viewType)
      Inflates the new cell for the RecyclerView, gives the height, view and days depending on the view type, month view or week view

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

public CalendarAdapter.CalendarViewHolder onCreateViewHolder(@NonNull
                                                                       android.view.ViewGroup parent,
                                                                       int viewType)
        Inflates the new cell for the RecyclerView, gives the height, view and days depending on the view type, month view or week view
        Specified by:
        onCreateViewHolder in class androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<CalendarAdapter.CalendarViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        parent - The ViewGroup is the parent view that will hold the cell created
        viewType - The type of cell created (not relevant in this case)
        Returns:
        {CalendarViewHolder} The cell created for the RecyclerView

      • onBindViewHolder

        public void onBindViewHolder(@NonNull
                             CalendarAdapter.CalendarViewHolder holder,
                             int position)
        Initializes one cell from the RecyclerView, it sets the text to the day of the month using the date from the days array (in the position param), if it is equals to today's date, then it highlights it it also sets an "OnClickListener" and checks if it's a month view or week view, if it's a month view then "calendarFragment.onItemClick" function is called, if it's a month view then "calendarWeekViewFragment.onItemClick" function is called
        Specified by:
        onBindViewHolder in class androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<CalendarAdapter.CalendarViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        holder - The specific cell in the RecycleView
        position - The position of the cell in the RecyclerView
